content: Hi all. I am getting a 404 for http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/VhDir/. Was this superseded by http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/fhir-directory-query/? Thanks!
I'll look into what happened there and get it back again (and no it isn't superceded by that one)

It may have just been cleared out when we removed branches that hadn't been touched in three months from the CI server. If that's the case, retriggering a build from the CI dashboard or via curl would do the trick.

(We have adjusted the rules now so we will not remove the master branch build of a repository in the HL7 org from the CI server even it is stale. So this should not happen again.)
@Brian Postlethwaite looking for ci-build of vhDir.. can you poke the build?
@Robert Dieterle can you poke vhDir ci-build?
It hasn't been built in forever and seems to have some issues. I'm looking into it.
@Brian Postlethwaite look up 'the great ci-build purge of 2022'... meaning, all ci-builds were purged a few weeks ago.

did VhDir not get published after ballot reconciliation (or is that not done yet?)? I only find the ballot version formally published
http://hl7.org/fhir/uv/vhdir/history.html
I had a few minor QA edits to complete before publishing, then life got in the way. Still on my list.
CI build has been restored (thanks @Eric Haas for the assist on that)
